meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a snib.
meanings.sent1: She was snibbing the gate shut before the storm.
meanings.sent2: He always snibbed the window tightly to keep the cold out.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was snibbing the acorn in its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The detective snibbed the evidence together to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The farmer snibbed the fence to protect his crops from animals.

meanings.definition: The act of snibbing a door or window.
meanings.sent1: The snibbing of the door was done to keep the room private.
meanings.sent2: She heard the snibbing of the window as the wind picked up.
meanings.sent3: The snibbing of the door made the house feel cozy and safe.
meanings.sent4: The loud snibbing of the window startled the cat.
meanings.sent5: The snibbing of the door echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.sent1: The old snibbing on the latch needed replacing.
meanings.sent2: He examined the snibbing closely to understand its mechanism.
meanings.sent3: The shiny snibbing caught the sunlight and sparkled.
meanings.sent4: The intricate design of the snibbing impressed the locksmith.
meanings.sent5: The rusty snibbing was difficult to turn to lock the door.
